data.name: Bulbasaur
data.flavorText: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ivysaur
data.flavorText: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Venusaur ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Tranquil Flower
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dangerous Toxwhip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Charizard ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brave Wing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosive Vortex
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.name: Wartortle
data.flavorText: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

attacks.name: Free Diving
attacks.text: Put up to 3 Basic Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Blastoise ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Twin Cannons
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 140 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

attacks.name: Leaf Munch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Grass Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.

attacks.name: Defensive Posture
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bye-Bye Flight
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Shuffle that Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck, and then shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

abilities.name: Cocoon Cover
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

attacks.name: Nadir Needle
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack does 120 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Pidgey
data.flavorText: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Pidgeotto
data.flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

data.name: Pidgeot
data.flavorText: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Rattata
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is common but hazardous. Its sharp incisors can easily cut right through hard wood.

attacks.name: Gnaw the Wound
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Raticate
data.flavorText: Its whiskers are essential for maintaining its balance. No matter how friendly you are, it will get angry and bite you if you touch its whiskers.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Spearow
data.flavorText: Due to its short wings, it can't fly long distances. It wanders about restlessly and pecks at bug Pokémon.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

data.name: Fearow
data.flavorText: Carrying food through Fearow's territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!

attacks.name: Beak Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food. It swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg gets stuck, and Ekans faints.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Arbok ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Menacing Fangs
attacks.text: Your opponent discards 2 cards from their hand.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

abilities.name: Electrical Grounding
abilities.text: When 1 of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, you may move a Lightning Energy from that Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Sandshrew
data.flavorText: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

abilities.name: Sand Screen
abilities.text: Trainer cards in your opponent's discard pile can't be put into their deck by an effect of your opponent's Item or Supporter cards.

data.name: Sandslash
data.flavorText: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Spike Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Nidoran ♀
data.flavorText: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran's horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male's horn.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Nidorina
data.flavorText: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

attacks.name: Fetch Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Nidoqueen
data.flavorText: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

attacks.name: Queen Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.name: Nidoran ♂
data.flavorText: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it's friendly with.

data.name: Nidorino
data.flavorText: It's nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

data.name: Nidoking
data.flavorText: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It's forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

abilities.name: Enthusiastic King
abilities.text: If you have Nidoqueen in play, ignore all Energy in the costs of attacks used by this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Venomous Impact
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Clefairy
data.flavorText: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

attacks.name: Moon-Viewing Invitation
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Clefairy and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Clefable
data.flavorText: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.

attacks.name: Follow Me
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

attacks.name: More Moon
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Ninetales ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mirrored Flames
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 140 more damage.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Stompy Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Wigglytuff ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Expanding Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.

attacks.name: Friend Tackle
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Zubat
data.flavorText: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun's light won't reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.

abilities.name: Revealing Echo
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

data.name: Golbat
data.flavorText: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

abilities.name: Semi-Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Vileplume
data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

abilities.name: Fully Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Paras
data.flavorText: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.

attacks.name: Spore Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Parasect
data.flavorText: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on its back having become the main body. If the mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.

attacks.name: Spread Filaments
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Search your deck for a number of Grass Pokémon up to the number of heads and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Venonat
data.flavorText: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.

data.name: Venomoth
data.flavorText: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.

attacks.name: Perplexing Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

data.name: Dugtrio
data.flavorText: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

attacks.name: Come Here Right Meow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

data.name: Persian
data.flavorText: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

abilities.name: Rocket Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Giovanni's Charisma card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

attacks.name: Overthink
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever they flip a coin, treat it as tails.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.

attacks.name: Aquatic Rescue
attacks.text: Put up to 4 Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.

attacks.name: Rant and Rave
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Raging Smash
attacks.text: If this Pokémon isn't Confused, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

attacks.name: Vaporize
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.

attacks.name: Torrid Torrent
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamite Fang
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Poliwag
data.flavorText: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Poliwhirl
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies' grasp and escape.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Poliwrath
data.flavorText: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Heroic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.name: Abra
data.flavorText: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.

data.name: Kadabra
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.

attacks.name: Teleportation Attack
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Alakazam ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimensional Hand
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is on the Bench.

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

attacks.name: Mountain Mashing
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Machoke
data.flavorText: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

attacks.name: Mountain Ramming
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Machamp
data.flavorText: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.text: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

attacks.name: Mountain Chopping
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Bellsprout
data.flavorText: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Weepinbell
data.flavorText: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.

data.name: Victreebel
data.flavorText: Once ingested into this Pokémon's body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Acid
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, put 12 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.

attacks.name: Poisonous Whip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tentacular Panic
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 90 damage for each heads. If the first flip is tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Geodude
data.flavorText: It uses both hands to climb precipitous cliffs. People who see it in action have been known to take up bouldering.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Graveler
data.flavorText: It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a river, it will explode with its last gasp.

attacks.name: Rock Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Golem ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dynamic Roll
attacks.text: During your next turn, attacks used by this Pokémon do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Blaster
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Ponyta
data.flavorText: If you've been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Rapidash
data.flavorText: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd's pace and direction of travel.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mach Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

attacks.name: Sea Bathing
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.

attacks.name: Big Yawn
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Laid-Back Tackle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved during this turn, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

attacks.name: Junk Magnet
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Item cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Farfetch'd
data.flavorText: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

attacks.name: Package Deal
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Doduo
data.flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Dodrio
data.flavorText: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.

abilities.name: Zooming Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 1 damage counter on this Pokémon. If you do, draw a card.

attacks.name: Ballistic Beak
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don't bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.

data.name: Dewgong
data.flavorText: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

attacks.name: Gummy Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: It's thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

attacks.name: Sticky Jail
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.

attacks.name: Shell Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Cloyster
data.flavorText: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

attacks.name: Protect Charge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 80 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

abilities.name: Spirit Return
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your opponent's discard pile into their hand.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 50 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Hollow Dive
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

attacks.name: Thumpalanche
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. This attack does 80 damage for each Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of exactly 4 that you discarded in this way.

data.name: Drowzee
data.flavorText: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.

data.name: Hypno
data.flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

abilities.name: Here for Hypnosis
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Asleep.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

attacks.name: Salt Water
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Kingler
data.flavorText: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it's not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

attacks.name: Bang Boom Chain
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may discard any number of Pokémon Tools from your Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: These Pokémon get nervous when they're not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Exeggutor
data.flavorText: When they work together, Exeggutor's three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Cubone
data.flavorText: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone's dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

abilities.name: Cheering Bone
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, attacks used by your Marowak do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hit Twice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Marowak
data.flavorText: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak's temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

attacks.name: Bone Throw
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

attacks.name: Twister Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Excited Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Excited Punch attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Lickitung
data.flavorText: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung's main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.

attacks.name: Tongue-Tied
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

attacks.name: Suspicious Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Weezing
data.flavorText: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.

abilities.name: Let's Have a Blast
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Spinning Fumes
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

data.name: Rhydon
data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Charismatic Drill
attacks.text: If you played Giovanni's Charisma from your hand during this turn, this attack does 140 more damage.

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

abilities.name: Lucky Bonus
abilities.text: If you took this Pokémon as a face-down Prize card during your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench. If you put this Pokémon onto your Bench in this way, flip a coin. If heads, take 1 more Prize card.

data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

attacks.name: Tactful Tangling
attacks.text: If you played Erika's Invitation from your hand during this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Kangaskhan ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Incessant Punching
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Seadra's mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that's larger than the opening of its mouth.

attacks.name: Blinding Ink
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips 2 coins. If either of them is tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Goldeen
data.flavorText: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

attacks.name: Triple Strike
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Seaking
data.flavorText: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

attacks.name: Swim Freely
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Horn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn't bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

abilities.name: Mysterious Comet
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, discard this Pokémon and all attached cards.

data.name: Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: It's known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

abilities.name: Mimic Barrier
abilities.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

attacks.name: Helpful Slash
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Grass Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Jynx ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heart-Stopping Kiss
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.

attacks.name: Electro Combo
attacks.text: If Magmar is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: These Pokémon's bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.

attacks.name: Flare Combo
attacks.text: If Electabuzz is on your Bench, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Pinsir
data.flavorText: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.

attacks.name: Reckless Throw
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Tauros
data.flavorText: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

attacks.name: Gather the Crew
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.

attacks.name: Splashy Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw a card.

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

abilities.name: Untamed One
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you must discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

attacks.name: Hop on My Back
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Ditto
data.flavorText: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.

abilities.name: Transformative Start
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may search your deck and choose a Basic Pokémon you find there, except any Ditto. If you do, discard this Pokémon and all attached cards, and put the chosen Pokémon in its place. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

attacks.name: Colorful Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon of different types, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Vaporeon
data.flavorText: It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Whirlpool
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Jolteon
data.flavorText: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fighting Lightning
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Flareon
data.flavorText: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Destructive Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Blaze
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Porygon
data.flavorText: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.

attacks.name: Conversion 4
attacks.text: Choose Grass, Fire, Water, Lightning, Psychic, Fighting, Darkness, Metal, or Dragon type. Until the Defending Pokémon leaves the Active Spot, its Weakness is now that type. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

data.name: Omanyte
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it's just drifting along.

attacks.name: Tentacular Return
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.name: Omastar
data.flavorText: Omastar's sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.

abilities.name: Primordial Tentacles
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Active Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Aqua Split
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Kabuto
data.flavorText: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

data.name: Kabutops
data.flavorText: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.

abilities.name: Ancient Way
abilities.text: Apply Weakness for your opponent's Active Pokémon as ×4 instead.

attacks.name: Draining Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Aerodactyl
data.flavorText: Aerodactyl's sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

attacks.name: Devolution Ray
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an evolved Pokémon, devolve it by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

abilities.name: Voraciousness
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put up to 2 Leftovers cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Thudding Press
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Articuno
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.

abilities.name: Ice Float
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Zapdos ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Voltaic Float
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Lightning Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Multishot Lightning
attacks.text: This attack also does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

abilities.name: Flare Float
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Blazing Flight
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.

data.name: Dragonair
data.flavorText: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Dragonite
data.flavorText: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.

abilities.name: Jet Cruise
abilities.text: Your Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

data.name: Mewtwo
data.flavorText: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reflective Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psyslash
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Mew ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restart
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Genome Hacking
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Antique Dome Fossil
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. This card can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat.  At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

abilities.name: Domed Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Antique Helix Fossil
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. This card can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat.  At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

abilities.name: Helical Swell
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand.

data.name: Antique Old Amber
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. This card can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat.  At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

abilities.name: Amber Protection
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Big Air Balloon
rules: The Stage 2 Pokémon this card is attached to has no Retreat Cost.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Bill's Transfer
rules: Look at the top 8 cards of your deck. You may reveal any number of Pokémon you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Cycling Road
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a Basic Energy card from their hand in order to draw a card.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Daisy's Help
rules: Draw 2 cards. Look at your face-down Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Energy Sticker
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a Basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Erika's Invitation
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench. If you put a Pokémon onto their Bench in this way, switch in that Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Giovanni's Charisma
rules: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand. If you do, attach an Energy card from your hand to your Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Grabber
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you put a Pokémon you find there on the bottom of their deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Leftovers
rules: At the end of your turn, if the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot, heal 20 damage from it.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Protective Goggles
rules: The Basic Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Rigid Band
rules: The Stage 1 Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Bulbasaur
data.flavorText: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ivysaur
data.flavorText: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.name: Wartortle
data.flavorText: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

attacks.name: Free Diving
attacks.text: Put up to 3 Basic Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

attacks.name: Leaf Munch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Grass Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Nidoking
data.flavorText: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It's forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

abilities.name: Enthusiastic King
abilities.text: If you have Nidoqueen in play, ignore all Energy in the costs of attacks used by this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Venomous Impact
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

attacks.name: Overthink
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever they flip a coin, treat it as tails.

data.name: Poliwhirl
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies' grasp and escape.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Machoke
data.flavorText: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

attacks.name: Mountain Ramming
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

attacks.name: Tactful Tangling
attacks.text: If you played Erika's Invitation from your hand during this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: It's known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

abilities.name: Mimic Barrier
abilities.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Omanyte
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it's just drifting along.

attacks.name: Tentacular Return
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.name: Dragonair
data.flavorText: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Venusaur ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Tranquil Flower
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dangerous Toxwhip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Charizard ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brave Wing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosive Vortex
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Blastoise ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Twin Cannons
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 140 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Arbok ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Menacing Fangs
attacks.text: Your opponent discards 2 cards from their hand.

data.name: Ninetales ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mirrored Flames
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 140 more damage.

data.name: Wigglytuff ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Expanding Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.

attacks.name: Friend Tackle
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Alakazam ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimensional Hand
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is on the Bench.

data.name: Golem ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dynamic Roll
attacks.text: During your next turn, attacks used by this Pokémon do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Blaster
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Kangaskhan ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Incessant Punching
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.name: Jynx ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heart-Stopping Kiss
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Zapdos ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Voltaic Float
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Lightning Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Multishot Lightning
attacks.text: This attack also does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mew ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restart
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Genome Hacking
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Bill's Transfer
rules: Look at the top 8 cards of your deck. You may reveal any number of Pokémon you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Daisy's Help
rules: Draw 2 cards. Look at your face-down Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Erika's Invitation
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench. If you put a Pokémon onto their Bench in this way, switch in that Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Giovanni's Charisma
rules: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand. If you do, attach an Energy card from your hand to your Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Venusaur ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Tranquil Flower
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dangerous Toxwhip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Charizard ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brave Wing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosive Vortex
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Blastoise ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Twin Cannons
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 140 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Alakazam ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimensional Hand
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is on the Bench.

data.name: Zapdos ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

rules: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench. If you put a Pokémon onto their Bench in this way, switch in that Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

rules: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand. If you do, attach an Energy card from your hand to your Active Pokémon.

rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restart
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
